meanings.definition: To express an intention to harm or punish someone.
meanings.sent1: He threated to tell the teacher if she didn't share the crayons.
meanings.sent2: The bully threated to take his lunch money if he didn't give it willingly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel threated to steal all the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds threated to unleash their fury on the small town below.
meanings.sent5: The dragon threated to breathe fire on anyone who dared to approach its cave.

meanings.definition: To be a source of danger or harm to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The sharp knife threated his fingers as he tried to cut the vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The dark alley threated to conceal unknown dangers for those who passed through.
meanings.sent3: The old bridge threated to collapse under the weight of the heavy truck.
meanings.sent4: The virus threated to spread rapidly throughout the crowded city.
meanings.sent5: The wild animal threated the safety of the campers in the forest.
